questions.question: What is the primary role of an operating system (OS)?
options: To act as an intermediary between the user and hardware
To execute user programs and serve users

questions.question: What is the kernel in an operating system?
options: The interface between hardware and user programs
A program that provides only user interfaces
A software to run application programs

questions.question: Which type of operating system increases CPU utilization by running multiple programs in memory?
Which operating system type is strictly time-bounded?
What is the main difference between hard and soft real-time systems?
options: Hard real-time systems have strict time constraints, while soft real-time systems are flexible.
Soft real-time systems are faster than hard real-time systems.
Hard real-time systems run only on Linux.
Soft real-time systems do not require scheduling.
questions.answer: Hard real-time systems have strict time constraints, while soft real-time systems are flexible.

questions.question: Which part of a process memory is used for global and static variables?
What is the function of the Process Control Block (PCB)?
options: To store information required to track a process
questions.answer: To store information required to track a process

questions.question: In the process state transition diagram, which state indicates a process is waiting for an I/O event?
What does the term 'Burst Time' refer to in process scheduling?
options: The time a process spends waiting in the queue
The time required for a process to complete execution
The time taken to switch between processes
The time a process waits for I/O operations
questions.answer: The time required for a process to complete execution

questions.question: What is a characteristic of First Come First Serve (FCFS) scheduling?
options: Tasks are executed based on priority levels.
It is a preemptive scheduling algorithm.
Tasks are executed in the order they arrive.
It minimizes waiting time for all processes.
questions.answer: Tasks are executed in the order they arrive.

questions.question: Which CPU scheduling algorithm selects the process with the smallest execution time next?
What is the main advantage of the Round Robin (RR) scheduling algorithm?
options: Fair allocation of CPU time slices
questions.answer: Fair allocation of CPU time slices

questions.question: What does 'Turnaround Time' represent in scheduling terms?
options: Time when a process first enters the ready queue
Time taken for a process to complete execution from arrival
Time spent waiting for the CPU
Time required for process context switching
questions.answer: Time taken for a process to complete execution from arrival
